text: ਨੀਲ ਵਸਤ੍ਰ ਪਹਿਰਿ ਹੋਵਹਿ ਪਰਵਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: Wearing blue robes, they seek the approval of the Muslim rulers.

transliteration.text: nīl vasatr pahir hōvah paravān .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਮਲੇਛ ਧਾਨੁ ਲੇ ਪੂਜਹਿ ਪੁਰਾਣੁ ॥

translation.text: Accepting bread from the Muslim rulers, they still worship the Puraanas.

transliteration.text: malēsh dhān lē pūjah purān .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:

As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਅਭਾਖਿਆ ਕਾ ਕੁਠਾ ਬਕਰਾ ਖਾਣਾ ॥

translation.text: They eat the meat of the goats, killed after the Muslim prayers are read over them,

transliteration.text: abhākhiā kā kuthā bakarā khānā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

text: ਚਉਕੇ ਉਪਰਿ ਕਿਸੈ ਨ ਜਾਣਾ ॥

translation.text: but they do not allow anyone else to enter their kitchen areas.

transliteration.text: chaukē upar kisai n jānā .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. text: ਦੇ ਕੈ ਚਉਕਾ ਕਢੀ ਕਾਰ ॥

translation.text: They draw lines around them, plastering the ground with cow-dung.

transliteration.text: dē kai chaukā kadhī kār .

This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਉਪਰਿ ਆਇ ਬੈਠੇ ਕੂੜਿਆਰ ॥

translation.text: The false come and sit within them.

transliteration.text: upar āi baithē kūriār .

As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਮਤੁ ਭਿਟੈ ਵੇ ਮਤੁ ਭਿਟੈ ॥ ਇਹੁ ਅੰਨੁ ਅਸਾਡਾ ਫਿਟੈ ॥

translation.text: They cry out, "Do not touch our food, or it will be polluted!"

transliteration.text: mat bhitai vē mat bhitai . ih ann asādā phitai .

Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਤਨਿ ਫਿਟੈ ਫੇੜ ਕਰੇਨਿ ॥

translation.text: But with their polluted bodies, they commit evil deeds.

transliteration.text: tan phitai phēr karēn .

text: ਮਨਿ ਜੂਠੈ ਚੁਲੀ ਭਰੇਨਿ ॥

translation.text: With filthy minds, they try to cleanse their mouths.

transliteration.text: man jūthai chulī bharēn .

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਕਹੁ ਨਾਨਕ ਸਚੁ ਧਿਆਈਐ ॥

translation.text: Says Nanak, meditate on the True Lord.

transliteration.text: kah nānak sach dhiāīai .

text: ਸੁਚਿ ਹੋਵੈ ਤਾ ਸਚੁ ਪਾਈਐ ॥੨॥

translation.text: If you are pure, you will obtain the True Lord. ||2||

text: ਪਉੜੀ ॥

translation.text: Pauree:

transliteration.text: paurī .

text: ਚਿਤੈ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸਭੁ ਕੋ ਵੇਖਿ ਨਦਰੀ ਹੇਠਿ ਚਲਾਇਦਾ ॥

translation.text: All are within Your mind; You see and move them under Your Glance of Grace, O Lord.

transliteration.text: chitai andar sabh kō vēkh nadarī hēth chalāidā .

text: ਆਪੇ ਦੇ ਵਡਿਆਈਆ ਆਪੇ ਹੀ ਕਰਮ ਕਰਾਇਦਾ ॥

translation.text: You Yourself grant them glory, and You Yourself cause them to act.

text: ਵਡਹੁ ਵਡਾ ਵਡ ਮੇਦਨੀ ਸਿਰੇ ਸਿਰਿ ਧੰਧੈ ਲਾਇਦਾ ॥

translation.text: The Lord is the greatest of the great; great is His world. He enjoins all to their tasks.

transliteration.text: vadah vadā vad mēdanī sirē sir dhandhai lāidā .

text: ਨਦਰਿ ਉਪਠੀ ਜੇ ਕਰੇ ਸੁਲਤਾਨਾ ਘਾਹੁ ਕਰਾਇਦਾ ॥

translation.text: If he should cast an angry glance, He can transform kings into blades of grass.

text: ਦਰਿ ਮੰਗਨਿ ਭਿਖ ਨ ਪਾਇਦਾ ॥੧੬॥

translation.text: Even though they may beg from door to door, no one will give them charity. ||16||

text: ਜੇ ਮੋਹਾਕਾ ਘਰੁ ਮੁਹੈ ਘਰੁ ਮੁਹਿ ਪਿਤਰੀ ਦੇਇ ॥

translation.text: The thief robs a house, and offers the stolen goods to his ancestors.

transliteration.text: jē mōhākā ghar muhai ghar muh pitarī dēi .

text: ਅਗੈ ਵਸਤੁ ਸਿਞਾਣੀਐ ਪਿਤਰੀ ਚੋਰ ਕਰੇਇ ॥

translation.text: In the world hereafter, this is recognized, and his ancestors are considered thieves as well.

text: ਵਢੀਅਹਿ ਹਥ ਦਲਾਲ ਕੇ ਮੁਸਫੀ ਏਹ ਕਰੇਇ ॥

translation.text: The hands of the go-between are cut off; this is the Lord's justice.

translation.text: so does falsehood dwell in the mouth of the false; they suffer forever, again and again.

transliteration.text: jūthē jūthā mukh vasai nit nit hōi khuār .

The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

translation.text: They are not called pure, who sit down after merely washing their bodies.

translation.text: With saddled horses, as fast as the wind, and harems decorated in every way;

text: ਚੀਜ ਕਰਨਿ ਮਨਿ ਭਾਵਦੇ ਹਰਿ ਬੁਝਨਿ ਨਾਹੀ ਹਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: They act out their minds' desires, but they do not understand the Lord, and so they are ruined.

text: ਕਰਿ ਫੁਰਮਾਇਸਿ ਖਾਇਆ ਵੇਖਿ ਮਹਲਤਿ ਮਰਣੁ ਵਿਸਾਰਿਆ ॥

translation.text: How can it be protected from impurity? It touches our own kitchen.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:
Guru Nanak Dev Ji [1469 - 1539] was the first Guru of the Sikhs born in a village named Talwandi which is now called Nankana Sahib and is in Pakistan. As a child Guru Nanak spent most of his time in isolation and meditation. He slept only for a few hours, ate small quantities of food and spoke little.

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਖਾਣਾ ਪੀਣਾ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰੁ ਹੈ ਦਿਤੋਨੁ ਰਿਜਕੁ ਸੰਬਾਹਿ ॥

translation.text: Eating and drinking are pure, since the Lord gives nourishment to all.

transliteration.text: khānā pīnā pavitr hai ditōn rijak sanbāh .

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.

author.author: Guru Nanak Dev
author.description:

One day he disappeared while having his morning bath and reappeared 3 days later and said: There is no Hindu and there is no Muslim. By saying this he meant that titles were meaningless because all of humanity is one and the light of God shines within everyone.

text: ਨਾਨਕ ਜਿਨ੍ਹੀ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬੁਝਿਆ ਤਿਨ੍ਹਾ ਸੂਤਕੁ ਨਾਹਿ ॥੩॥

translation.text: O Nanak, the Gurmukhs, who understand the Lord, are not stained by impurity. ||3||

transliteration.text: nānak jinhī guramukh bujhiā tinhā sūtak nāh .3.

melody.description: Aasaa has strong emotions of inspiration and courage. This Raag gives the listener the determination and ambition to put aside any excuses and to proceed with the necessary action to achieve the aim. It generates feelings of passion and zeal to succeed and the energy generated from these feelings enables the listener to find the strength from within to achieve success, even when the achievement seems difficult. The determined mood of this Raag ensures that failure is not an option and motivates the listener to be inspired.
